senses.de: To refrain from giving or revealing something
senses.ex: I didn't mean to withhold the truth from you.

Tips.title: Selective Sharing
Tips.description: Used when someone chooses not to share specific information deliberately.
Tips.example: He decided to withhold the client list from the meeting.

Tips.title: Strategic Silence
Tips.description: Often implies a strategic or purposeful reason for not revealing something.
Tips.example: She chose to withhold her plans until the time was right.

senses.de: To stop oneself from doing or expressing something
senses.ex: With all the evidence, I couldn't withhold my criticism.

Tips.title: Emotional Control
Tips.description: Indicates control over expressions of feelings or thoughts.
Tips.example: Despite being angry, he withheld his response in the meeting.

Tips.title: Judgement Consideration
Tips.description: Shows careful consideration before expressing opinions or judgements.
Tips.example: She withheld judgement until all facts were presented.

senses.de: To deduct or retain a portion of money
senses.ex: I withhold taxes from my paycheck for the IRS.

Tips.title: Paycheck Deductions
Tips.description: Refers to money taken out of a salary before a person receives it.
Tips.example: A certain amount was withheld from his paycheck for insurance coverage.

Tips.title: Legal Requirement
Tips.description: Often relates to mandatory deductions like taxes or child support.
Tips.example: The company must withhold a percentage of your pay for social security.

Conceal.wordDefinition:
The words conceal and withhold both mean to keep something hidden or secret.

However, conceal usually means to hide something physical or tangible, whereas withhold generally means to keep information or something intangible back.

For example, if you put a gift in a closet so that someone won't find it, you are concealing the gift. If you don't tell your friend a secret you were told, you are withholding information.

Conceal is used when you are hiding a physical object, while withhold is used when you are keeping information or something abstract to yourself.

Hold back.wordDefinition:
The words hold back and withhold both mean to keep something from someone or something, but they are used in slightly different ways.

Hold back is often used when you are talking about holding back emotions or physical objects. For example, you might hold back tears when you are sad, or hold back a dog on a leash to keep it from running away.

Withhold is typically used when talking about keeping something from someone else, often something that they expect or are entitled to.

For example, a bank might withhold someone's money if they have not met certain requirements or if there is suspicion of fraudulent activity.

- Hold back is used when holding back emotions or physical objects

- Withhold is used when keeping something from someone else that they are entitled to or expecting.

Keep back.wordDefinition:
The phrase keep back means to hold something or someone in a specific place or stop them from moving forward. For example, the police might keep back a crowd trying to get too close to a crime scene.

Withhold means to hold back or not give something that is due or expected. For example, a company might withhold an employee's salary if they don't complete their work properly.

So while both phrases involve holding back, keep back is more physical and often used to control crowds or objects, and withhold is more abstract and often used in situations where something is being denied or cut off.

Refrain.wordDefinition:
Refrain means to hold back from doing something or to avoid doing it altogether. For example, if someone has a bad habit of interrupting others, they might try to refrain from interrupting.

So, in short, refrain is used when you want to stop yourself from doing something, while withhold is used when you want to stop something from being given or shared with someone else.

Restrain.wordDefinition:
Restrain means to hold back or stop someone from doing something.

Restrain is used when talking about stopping a person from doing something, while withhold is used when talking about holding back information or something else that is not a person.

Retain.wordDefinition:
Retain means to keep or hold on to something without letting it go. It is applicable when you want to keep something for future use or possession.

For example, you may retain your old clothes to wear them again someday. You may withhold your earnings from a business partner if they did not fulfill their part of the agreement.

Stop.wordDefinition:
Stop means to end or cease an action or activity completely.

For example, if someone is running towards a busy street, shouting "stop!" would immediately make them halt completely.

Suppress.wordDefinition:
Suppress means to prevent something from being seen or heard.

For example, if a person feels angry but suppresses their anger, they may appear calm on the outside even though they are upset on the inside.

Suppress describes hiding or controlling something, while withhold describes not giving something that is due or expected.

videos.Text: And yet, they always manage to get the result that they want. So how does this work? How can we explain this strange phenomenon? Well, it turns out that what happens is the negative data goes missing in action; it's withheld from doctors and patients. And this is the most important aspect of the whole story. It's at the top of the pyramid of evidence.

They had yet to confirm their theories about racial difference, and they believed they would never have another opportunity to observe the long-term effects of untreated syphilis. The study’s leadership decided to withhold knowledge of new treatments from their subjects.

quotes.Text: Sometimes I want to withhold judgement on whether something is good or bad, but I do feel like identifying with TV characters - connecting to them emotionally more than you connect to literal, physical people in your life - causes problems. They just don't have the same existence or boundaries as you do. They resemble us, but they are not us.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Alexandra Kleeman

quotes.Text: In order to feel loved, be respected and stay connected, we humans have a tendency to lie. We lie about who we are, what we want, what we need, what we have done or will do. Perhaps 'lie' is too strong a word. Let me say that what we do is withhold the truth.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Iyanla Vanzant

quotes.Text: I would never withhold information about the murder of my man Biggie, or anybody else. It's just silly and ridiculous. The accusations are just flying out. All I've been trying to do all my life is to make great music.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Sean Combs

quotes.Text: When I write that I've known about something for a long time, that's not a boast. That's a confession. It's me acknowledging that I have withheld something important from the public.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Matt Apuzzo

quotes.Text: Inequality reigns in horrifying ways, and not everyone can even read, but the world of media and advertising withholds very little from the imagination of the dispossessed.
quotes.Title: Indian Writer
quotes.Name: Amitava Kumar

quotes.Text: We are never doing anyone any favors by withholding our gifts from the world. It's scary to be fierce, but you can't compromise that for fear of losing those around you.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Idina Menzel

quotes.Text: If you're not putting enough away for emergencies or retirement, making commitments in advance, such as signing up for payroll withholding, can help.
quotes.Title: American Economist
quotes.Name: Richard Thaler

quotes.Text: Respect commands itself and can neither be given nor withheld when it is due.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Eldridge Cleaver

quotes.Text: All the experience of the greatest city in the world could not withhold me.
quotes.Title: English Author
quotes.Name: Henry Williamson

quotes.Text: I think that much of the truth has been withheld from the American people.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Nancy Pelosi
